fmri_rlm

Source: R/fmrirlm.R
fmri_rlm.Rd

robust linear modeling of fmri data

fmri_rlm(
  formula,
  block_formula,
  baseline_model = NULL,
  dataset,
  durations,
  drop_empty = TRUE,
  contrasts = NULL,
  strategy = c("runwise", "slicewise", "all")
)

Arguments

formula

the model formula for experimental events
baseline_model

the baseline_model object
dataset

an object derived from fmri_dataset containing the time-series data
durations

a vector of event durations
drop_empty

whether to remove factor levels with size of zero
contrasts

a set of contrasts
strategy

the data splitting strategy

Examples

etab <- data.frame(onset=c(1,30,15,25), fac=factor(c("A", "B", "A", "B")), run=c(1,1,2,2))
etab2 <- data.frame(onset=c(1,30,65,75), fac=factor(c("A", "B", "A", "B")), run=c(1,1,1,1))
mat <- matrix(rnorm(100*100), 100,100)
dset <- matrix_dataset(mat, TR=1, run_length=c(50,50),event_table=etab)
dset2 <- matrix_dataset(mat, TR=1, run_length=c(100),event_table=etab2)
lm.1 <- fmri_rlm(onset ~ hrf(fac), block_formula= ~ run,dataset=dset)

#> Error in .setup_model(dataset, formula, block_formula, baseline_model,     contrasts): could not find function ".setup_model"
lm.2 <- fmri_rlm(onset ~ hrf(fac), block_formula= ~ run,dataset=dset2)

#> Error in .setup_model(dataset, formula, block_formula, baseline_model,     contrasts): could not find function ".setup_model"
